title.narrative: 302 SAFE DRINKING WATER

description.narrative: By 2022 the government and partners are able to plan and implement the delivery of equitable, gender responsive safe drinking water in selected settings targeting the most deprived families and households, which contributes to Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Infants, young children, and caregivers especially the most vulnerable have equitable access to and use sustainable, safe, and affordable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services (including in Institutions) across the lifecycle.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022 the government and partners are able to plan and implement the delivery of equitable, gender responsive safe drinking water in selected settings targeting the most deprived families and households

description.narrative: 2019 was marked by the launch of the Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM), the PM flagship aiming at providing safe drinking water to 730 million rural Indians by 2024. UNICEF strengthened its position of lead technical partner for water, notably supporting: the development of the JJM guidelines, capacity development initiatives reaching all 250,000 GPs of India and the roll-out of a first of its kind water conservation and environmental sustainability campaign the Jal Shakti Abhiyan (JSA). This contributed to reach 420,000 additional people with access safe drinking water and 65,182,205 people through JSA in 257 water stressed districts. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020
